clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Intravenous Ephedrine in Preventing Intraoperative Hypothermia in Patients Undergoing Spinal Anesthesia for Arthroscopic Knee Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Intravenous Ephedrine in Preventing Intraoperative Hypothermia in Patients Undergoing Spinal Anesthesia for Arthroscopic Knee Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective double-blinded randomized controlled study to determine efficacy of ephedrine in preserving core temperature in patients under neuraxial spinal anesthesia for knee arthroscopic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: To determine the effect of ephedrine on preserving core temperature (tympanic) when given at finishing of local anesthetic administration for spinal neuraxial anesthesia comparing to normal saline (120 minutes period)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Pre-operative, before and after performing spinal anesthesia, every 10 minutes after performing spinal anesthesia in 120 minutes duration

secondary_outcome.description: Pre-operative, before and after performing spinal anesthesia, every 10 minutes after performing spinal anesthesia in 120 minutes duration
After performing spinal anesthesia in 120 minutes duration

arm_group.description: Intravenous 9 mg of ephedrine (3 ml) given at finishing local anesthetic administration for spinal anesthesia
Intravenous normal saline 3 ml given at finishing local anesthetic administration for spinal anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient undergoing knee or ankle arthroscopic surgery under spinal block at department of orthopaedic Ramathibodi Hospital
- BMI 17-30 kg/m2
- ASA physical status 1-3
- Age 18-70
- Last oral intake more than 6 hours (2 hours for water)
- Consent form acquired
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who are contraindicated for spinal block
- Anesthesia level higher than T4 or lower than T10
- Tympanic temperature more than 37.5 or less than 35.5 degrees Celsius
- Inflammation in external ear canal or tympanic menbrane
- Patients who receive alpha adrenergic blocker or beta adrenergic blocker
- Initial blood pressure presenting in operating theater 140 90 mmHg repeat after rest 5 minutes
- Patient refusal
